Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is thinly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394466) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394466)
